title: Macron says France to send more forces to Greenland
subhead: During his New Year address to the armed forces at Istres Air Base in southern France, President Emmanuel Macron said France would deploy additional 'land, air and maritime assets' to Greenland in the coming days.

title: Denmark and Greenland hit Trump administration's intransigence

'In the face of Trump's imperialism, realism means defending the law as an indispensable tool'
subhead: As the president shows his eagerness to dismantle any form of checks and balances both within and beyond the US borders, the principles of law paradoxically endure, explains Le Monde columnist Gilles Paris.

title: Uganda's veteran guerrilla, Yoweri Museveni, seeks a seventh term
subhead: In power for 40 years, the president once again stands before voters on Thursday, in a tightly controlled election amid mounting repression and open nepotism.

title: Behind France's declining birthrate, the complex question of wanting children
subhead: Official data released Tuesday show France's birth rate has reached its lowest point in more than a century. When it comes to understanding the decline in births, it is difficult to distinguish between individual choices, social norms and the various constraints faced by couples.

title: Greenlanders overwhelmed by Trump's ambitions: '$10,000 to annex the island, who does he think we are?'
subhead: Denmark deployed military reinforcements to the Inuit island on Wednesday evening, shortly after the US vice president and secretary of state and the Danish and Greenlandic foreign ministers met in Washington.

After celebrating Maduro ouster, Venezuelan migrants in US fear what lies ahead
subhead: After celebrating the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, Venezuelan asylum seekers in the US have begun to have doubts. In Denver, Colorado, where they number in the tens of thousands, many now fear having to go back to their country with the Chavistas still in power.

title: 'The Islamic Republic of Iran is entering its final phase'
subhead: Hemmed in by domestic and external crises, the Islamic Republic of Iran is now finding itself with nowhere left to turn, analyzes Farid Vahid, the co-director of the Observatory of North Africa and the Middle East at the Fondation Jean Jaur√®s.

title: Long before coveting Greenland, the US expanded by opening its checkbook
subhead: From the early 19th century on, the United States expanded by acquiring territory through purchase or force. By expressing interest in Greenland, Donald Trump has revived that tradition.

title: President Trump, Greenland does not want to become American
